file_content.text: Thanks again for stopping that overload. We'll get the factory cleaned up and safe soon as we can.
I don't believe it--I didn't think anyone could stop that factory from blowing sky high.
That was a hell of a risk, and a whole lot of people owe you their lives.
This isn't the last time the Empire's plans will threaten innocent lives.
It could happen again.
Oh, we'll be ready. Protecting these people is my job, and I aim to do it. Be safe out there.
All in a day's work.
Wish we had more people like you fighting the good fight. Be safe out there.
If you people weren't so inept, I wouldn't have to go running into burning factories.
No thanks to you and your men.
Yeah, well, like I said before--we're cops. We do what we can. For what it's worth, I appreciate your help.
Hurry--the engineer said those refining machines are going to blow any minute.
Master Jedi! We got a real problem here. One second...
Major! We got a disaster on our hands here. One second...
Am I glad to see you. We've got a serious problem on our hands. One second...
Hey--get Hayg on the commlink! If they don't evacuate those people in record time, we might as well start digging graves.
I'm on it!
Sorry--Corellia Chemical's about to blow sky high, and we've got a ton of civilians in the blast radius.
What's the situation at the plant?
Give me the facts.
What exactly is the scenario at the factory?
Give me the facts.
Give me a sit-rep for that factory.
Give me the facts.
What are we looking at over there?
Give me the facts.
The Republic tried to run a bunch of Imperials out of the factory, and the place took heavy damage.
What do you need to get those people to safety?
We have to get them out--now!
At this point, probably a miracle. The factory took heavy damage when Republic forces tried to run out the Imperials.
Why don't you try saving those people instead of standing around crying about it?
So shut up and get to work.
We're trying, but the factory took heavy damage when Republic forces tried to clear out the Imperials.
A fire inside's got the refining equipment ready to overload, and we're almost out of time.
If someone doesn't physically shut down those machines, that factory will be one giant chemical bomb going off in a civilian population.
I'll stop the overload. Anything else?
I'll take care of it.
Just get inside and shut down all the refining drives. But it'll be tough--the place is still crawling with Imperial battle droids.
And those things won't just stand around while you get the job done. Be ready to move fast and fight hard.
Do you have men inside trying to stop the overload?
Did you send anyone in?
That place is crawling with Imperial battle droids. I got a bunch of CorSec grunts and volunteers here. There's no way.
Stop beating around the bush.
I need you. We'd go in ourselves but we'd get slaughtered. The place is crawling with Imperial battle droids.
Those droids won't just stand around while someone shuts down the machines. We're talking heavy combat.
Look, it's a long shot, but we're out of options. Can you do it?
That explosion will not happen, I promise you.
I won't let those people die.
We have no choice but to stop that explosion.
I won't let those people die.
We got lives on the line--I'll stop that overload.
I won't let those people die.
Those folks are gonna be fine. Leave it to me.
I won't let those people die.
I hope you're right.
I never pass up a long shot.
Well you're not short on grit, I'll give you that. Just hurry--we're on the clock.
No way. [Refuse Quest]
Well then I guess I'm sending my boys in. They don't have much of a chance, but at least they got the guts to try.
Sorry, no time to talk. I've got an evacuation to deal with.
